definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Fang and Big Pang are divine birds which outstanding appearance in the Libai's poem.
sentences.chinese: 鳳和大鵬是李白詩中突出的神鳥意象。

sentences.english: The phoenix is a divine bird in Chinese ancient legend.
sentences.chinese: 鳳是中國古代傳說中的神鳥。

sentences.english: Is this the fabled Holy Bird flying to this treasure-ground to make its presence felt?
sentences.chinese: 難道這是傳說中的神鳥，飛到這塊寶地顯聖來了？

sentences.english: Landry is called God Bird, as he always flies high to get a slam dunk.
sentences.chinese: 蘭德里叫神鳥，因爲他總是能飛得很高扣籃。

sentences.english: Besides, they are regarded as divine birds and as the ever incarnation of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 佛經中，它被視爲神鳥，佛曾化身爲鸚鵡。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to be linked together/to be involved with/to collude/interconnection/involvement/collusion

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
